subject: Re: Filtering.
author: Travis
full_text:
I know what you mean. When I do run of the mill evp recordings with a 
digital recorder, when I amplify about 10db and apply noise reduction I 
get some high pitched squeal that is unmistakebly spoken words but not 
intelligible as to what its saying, definitely doesnt have any human 
tones in the voice though. I have no clue as to who/what they are, but 
its definitely spoken words. Regards,
                                    T.L.

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...> 
wrote:
>
> I usually don't do any filtering, but I'm finding alot of stuff in 
recent 
> recordings that I don't hear at all until I run the noise reduction. 
> 'course, non of it is "ghost voices" per se`, but these space(y) guys.
> 
> Frank-S
> 
> _________________________________________________________________
> Don't get caught with egg on your face. Play Chicktionary! 
> http://club.live.com/chicktionary.aspx?icid=chick_hotmailtextlink2
>
